TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit InputBindingCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
Public NotInheritable Class InputBindingCollection Implements IList
public ref class InputBindingCollection sealed : System::Collections::IList
type InputBindingCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents an ordered collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All objects that derive from <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> have an <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection> named <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.InputBindings%2A>. All objects that derive from <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> have an <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection> named <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.InputBindings%2A>.
However, if these collections are set in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], then the items in the collection must be derived classes of <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBinding> rather than direct <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBinding> objects. This is because <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBinding> does not support a default public constructor. Therefore, the items in a <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection> that was set in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] will typically be an <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBinding> derived class that does support a default public constructor, such as <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding>.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyGesture> and associates it with a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding>. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding> is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection> on a <xref:System.Windows.Window>.
[!code-xaml[commandingoverviewsnippets#CommandingOverviewXAMLKeyBinding](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CommandingOverviewSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml#commandingoverviewxamlkeybinding)]
[!code-csharp[commandingoverviewsnippets#CommandingOverviewKeyBinding](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CommandingOverviewSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#commandingoverviewkeybinding)] [!code-vb[commandingoverviewsnippets#CommandingOverviewKeyBinding](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CommandingOverviewSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#commandingoverviewkeybinding)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 Add(class System.Windows.Input.InputBinding inputBinding) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds the specified to this .
Docs.returns: Always returns 0. This deviates from the standard implementation for , which should return the index where the new item was added to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyGesture> and associates it with a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding>. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyBinding> is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection> on a <xref:System.Windows.Window>.
[!code-xaml[commandingoverviewsnippets#CommandingOverviewXAMLKeyBinding](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CommandingOverviewSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml#commandingoverviewxamlkeybinding)]
[!code-csharp[commandingoverviewsnippets#CommandingOverviewKeyBinding](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CommandingOverviewSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#commandingoverviewkeybinding)] [!code-vb[commandingoverviewsnippets#CommandingOverviewKeyBinding](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CommandingOverviewSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#commandingoverviewkeybinding)]
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] example does not literally use <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection.Add%2A>, but <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputBindingCollection.Add%2A> is called implicitly by the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] processing support for collections. For details on [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] and collections, see [XAML Overview (WPF)](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/xaml-overview-wpf.md).
